intro: Pterigeron filifolius, commonly known as the filifolius pterigeron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, arranged in clusters along the stems. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in tropical climates.
